terms.definition: An internal document that outlines what a product should accomplish for users without specifying implementation details, used by development teams to align with business requirements.
A centralized repository of information and documentation that provides self-service support for users to find answers to their questions without contacting support.
A support approach that allows customers to find answers and solve problems independently through documentation, without requiring assistance from support staff.
Documentation that describes new features, improvements, and bug fixes in a product update or release.
The distinctive features or benefits that make a product stand out from competitors, often highlighted in product documentation.
Enhanced search results that display additional information beyond standard title and description, improving visibility in search engine results pages.
A lightweight markup language with plain text formatting syntax, commonly used for creating documentation that can be converted to HTML.
A system that records changes to files over time, allowing specific versions to be recalled later and enabling collaboration on documentation.
The process of adapting content to a specific locale or market by translating text and modifying cultural references to resonate with the target audience.
The visual elements and interactive components through which users interact with a product, often referenced in documentation with screenshots.
The overall perception a customer has of a company based on all interactions, including their experience with product documentation.
The practice of optimizing content to improve its visibility in search engine results, applied to documentation to make it more discoverable.
The pages displayed by search engines in response to a user's search query, where well-optimized documentation can appear prominently.
The distinctive attitude and personality expressed through written communication, established through guidelines to ensure consistency in documentation.
A readability metric that indicates the comprehension difficulty of text, used to ensure documentation is accessible to the intended audience.
